author: sucy
title: Infrastructure/Fund tracking system
description: La corruption est souvent un problème lors de la construction d'infrastructures dans les pays en développement. Nous atténuons ce problème grâce à la documentation sur la chaîne.

f6_assessments.q0:
L'idée de base de la proposition est assez bonne, exploiter l'un des avantages de la blockchain (l'immuabilité) afin de forcer les gouvernements à publier des données pour suivre et surveiller les projets d'infrastructure, et c'est tout à fait dans le cadre du défi.
L'un des principaux avantages de ce type d'approche est qu'il pourrait être reproduit dans d'autres endroits, et la blockchain elle-même pourrait répondre au besoin d'une infrastructure supposée manquante.
L'impact d'une telle proposition sera limité à l'échelle mondiale (la population des îles Salomon en 2020 était de 686 878 habitants), mais se concentrer sur de petites réalités est probablement la seule façon de proposer un projet réalisable dans ce défi.
Pour cette proposition est déjà présenté un cas d'utilisation (http://www.sirdp.org.sb/) et c'est une bonne indication de quelque chose nécessaire et qui sera utilisé.
Malheureusement, la proposition ne présente qu'une description générique du concept de base qui la sous-tend et c'est la principale raison des 4 étoiles pour l'impact. Il serait bon de fournir plus de détails sur le mécanisme qui sera utilisé.
f6_assessments.q1:
L'équipe à l'origine de la proposition semble déjà liée au gouvernement des îles Salomon : la plateforme présentée (http://www.sirdp.org.sb/) qui sera migrée vers un système de blockchain est enregistrée par le " ministère de la planification du développement " et c'est une grande preuve d'une collaboration déjà en cours entre le proposant et le gouvernement des îles Salomon. Malheureusement, les liens ne sont pas inclus dans la proposition elle-même, il serait bon de les ajouter pour une référence plus facile.
Les compétences nécessaires au projet de développement sont donc présentes pour la partie "traditionnelle" du développement mais rien n'est présenté en ce qui concerne les compétences blockchain requises pour la livraison complète.
Il sera également très bon de lister et décrire l'architecture et les technologies qui seront impliquées :
- Allez-vous utiliser des métadonnées pour stocker les données ou un mécanisme différent ?
- Prévoyez-vous de développer un format de protocole pour assurer la cohérence des données soumises sur le long terme ?
- Comment allez-vous connecter le site web actuel à la blockchain ? Quels langages / technologies utiliserez-vous pour cela ?
- Y aura-t-il un mécanisme permettant aux utilisateurs publics d'accéder aux données de la blockchain (spécifique à ce champ d'application) ?
Il serait également très important de fournir une ventilation plus détaillée sur le développement des différentes étapes du projet, en essayant d'estimer le nombre d'heures et le budget qui seront nécessaires pour chaque étape.
Dans la feuille de route, il est indiqué une étape pour "Coopérer avec la Banque mondiale, ou une ONG pour recueillir les commentaires des utilisateurs", mais aucun détail supplémentaire n'est fourni et il n'y a aucune mention de cette partie du projet dans le budget.
En général, fournir des détails plus approfondis dans les propositions est vraiment important et pourrait vraiment améliorer la notation pour les critères de faisabilité.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of corruption in infrastructure funding by a decentralized platform for tracking infrastructure project fund usage which partially aligns with the challenge goal but is not a foundational registry solution listed in the challenge.  
The proposal could be improved by articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem, articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges, providing key metrics and goals that more closely align with the challenge and either selecting another challenge (Miscellaneous) or more closely aligning with this challenge's goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of team composition, additional funding plan (Fund 8 for Beta version), realistic timetable and plan, technical explanation of the solution (should be more  detailed)
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by evidence of experience (attached photos and description are insufficient), budget is broken down and may be reasonable but more details are needed like actual numbers of people in each role all of which are plural, and a challenges and risks section.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes a roadmap, milestones, time horizon, a clear understandable description of the targeted problem and a description of the solution that addresses the problem (should be more detailed).
To improve the proposal include metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposer clearly states the problem and offers a quality solution. This idea would definitely have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem if implemented. The proposal does not show how this idea will add value to the Cardano ecosystem, nor is Cardano mentioned at all. With such great ideas, it would be good to have missing KPIs because of that it's hard to compare KPIs with a challenge setting. Unfortunately this proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: It would be good to have information about the team and their work and how many people would work on this project. Perhaps there are links that would give a clear insight into the skills, knowledge and experience of the team and a link that can give us an insight into the teams work done so far. The budget is clearly shown but not broken down into identifiable items so it is difficult to conclude whether the amount requested is realistic for the implementation of this idea. Unfortunately a detailed implementing plan and details of actionable tasks and execution orders have not been developed and presented. It would be good to have elaborated time frames within which the work will be completed and list the necessary resources and technical aspects required for implementation. With ideas like these that involve governments and working with large sums of money, it would be good to have an idea of the potential risks as well.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, we do not have a detailed roadmap with milestones and KPIs in the proposal. Due to the lack of all the necessary information the community unfortunately can't track this proposal in any way.

f6_assessments.q0:
Great idea. No two ways this would be useful to many countries in the developing world. However, I think it would be helpful if it starts from a specific country and expands in a strategic manner. 

Also, it is stated as part of the roadmaps that, 'Co-op with World Bank, or NGO to collect the user feedback', 

I think the feedback from users should include a feature where locals or individual citizens can rate feedbacks or make input on it. 

The proposal is clear and concise and I think it addresses the challenge and should consider DAO in order to make the initiate independent from the government.
f6_assessments.q1: It would have been helpful to have included a Linkedin link to share the team's profile. More information needs to be worked on the proposal in defining success and metrics for measuring progress and implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Great breakdown of the budget. There is a need for the team to be open and transparent for auditing. Hence I would like that the team to document activities and include periodic progress reports on activities.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal clearly identifies a problem within the challenge and articulates how it will add value to the cardano ecosystem. The type of corruption that you want to attack must also be better worked on. When it comes to metrics, better work is required. In this way, I believe that the proposal can be improved for future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience presented is insufficient. The proponent does not provide sufficient evidence to determine her skills and experience in the proposal. The budget is not properly prepared and does not allow to identify the use that will be given to it. Nor is there a calendar that allows the development of the proposal to be identified.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not have a roadmap with clear milestones that allows observing a time horizon. This aspect is clearly insufficient and the process cannot be audited.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project if successful promises great impact in terms of preventing corruption, as well as demonstrating the power of Cardano in the governmental sector. 

However, corruption in developing countries is complex and multifaceted, and it's hard to understand how well the team has understood the problem in order to address this challenge efficiently, and incorporate it into the product development process. Would be much better if the team can demonstrate this further in order to convince assessors and voters.
f6_assessments.q1:
As discussed, the critical element of this project is the ability of the team to understand the mechanisms of governmental operations and how corruption happens, and the ability to work and test with real government in its customer development process. It must have been better if the proposer did give real reference (with links) and explanation to its past projects working with the government of Solomon Isands or Ghana, or its ability to reach out and work with World Bank. 

On the other hand, the proposer would have convinced assessors and voters better with more detailed roadmap with milestones and KPIS, as well as evidence and reference to the team's profiles. USD $60,000 is a big amount, and one expects more depth and well thought out plan from a proposal trying to work with governments.
f6_assessments.q2: Without a detail working plan, and description of what does success look like, it'd be hard to audit the progress and success of the proposal in action.

f6_assessments.q0: this is a good idea. However, what the proposal is missing is the need to clearly state how to add value to the Cardalo ecosystem and the scaling issues to solve the problem in the future. The solution gives the problem in accordance with the proposal
f6_assessments.q1: I believe the proposal achieves better success when the aspects need to be improved such as giving evidence of relevant factors in specific details. As for the proposed budget, the offer is very general. Books must be logically divided clearly into more specific sections
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks some important information such as more details about the proposed budget. If the proposal requires additional funding for implementation, the implementer needs to provide a clear and informed plan on how to use the funds. Information about the team of each person in the proposal. I recommend giving this information to the community to better evaluate, thank you

solution: Créer une plateforme décentralisée où les gouvernements peuvent suivre et contrôler les projets d'infrastructure et l'utilisation des fonds pour éviter la corruption.
experience: Notre équipe a élaboré un projet visant à créer un système complet de suivi et de contrôle des projets d'infrastructure dans les îles Salomon.
